meanings.definition: A person who moves stealthily or furtively.
meanings.sent1: The skulkers crept through the shadows, trying not to be seen.
meanings.sent2: The forest was full of skulkers, hiding behind trees and bushes.
meanings.sent3: The skulkers played a game of hide-and-seek, trying to outwit each other.
meanings.sent4: In the city, the skulkers were like ghosts, moving silently through the streets.
meanings.sent5: The skulkers in the spy movie were expert agents, blending into the background effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To move or hide in a stealthy or furtive manner.
meanings.sent1: She skulkers around the house, trying to avoid her annoying brother.
meanings.sent2: The thief skulkers in the dark alley, waiting for the perfect moment to strike.
meanings.sent3: The cat skulkers behind the couch, waiting to pounce on a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The clouds skulkers across the sky, hiding the sun from view.
meanings.sent5: He skulkers through the crowd, trying to reach the stage without being noticed.
